snippet: Sergei M. Guriev, now teaching at an elite Paris university, said investigators demanded that he surrender five years’ worth of e-mails and submit to searches.
abstract: Economist Sergei M Guriev says he fled Russia because he feared he would be prosecuted in a politically tinged case--centering on 2011 report he helped write that criticzed the prosecution of Mikhail B Khodorkovsky, rival of Pres Vladimir V Putin and oil tycoon.

byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Sergei M. Guriev, now teaching at an elite Paris university, said investigators demanded that he surrender five years’ worth of e-mails and submit to searches.

headline.seo: Economist Sergei Guriev Doesn’t Plan Return to Russia Soon
headline.main: Economist Who Fled Russia Cites Peril in Politically Charged Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Economist Who Fled Russia Cites Peril in Politically Charged Inquiry
